verses.verse: And it came to pass in those days <S%H3117><s%>, that the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> gathered <S%H6908><s%> their hosts <S%H4264><s%> together <S%H6908><s%> for warfare <S%H6635><s%>, to fight <S%H3898><s%> with Israel <S%H3478><s%>. And Achish <S%H397><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto David <S%H1732><s%>, Know <S%H3045><s%> thou assuredly <S%H3045><s%>, that thou shalt go out <S%H3318><s%> with me in the host <S%H4264><s%>, thou and thy men <S%H582><s%>.

And David <S%H1732><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to Achish <S%H397><s%>, Therefore <S%H3651><s%> thou shalt know <S%H3045><s%> what thy servant <S%H5650><s%> will do <S%H6213><s%>. And Achish <S%H397><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to David <S%H1732><s%>, Therefore will I make <S%H7760><s%> thee keeper <S%H8104><s%> of my head <S%H7218><s%> for ever <S%H3117><s%>.

Now Samuel <S%H8050><s%> was dead <S%H4191><s%>, and all Israel <S%H3478><s%> had lamented <S%H5594><s%> him <S%H6912><s%>, and buried him in Ramah <S%H7414><s%>, even in his own city <S%H5892><s%>. And Saul <S%H7586><s%> had put away <S%H5493><s%> those that had familiar spirits <S%H178><s%>, and the wizards <S%H3049><s%>, out of the land <S%H776><s%>.

And the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> gathered themselves together <S%H6908><s%>, and came <S%H935><s%> and encamped <S%H2583><s%> in Shunem <S%H7766><s%>: and Saul <S%H7586><s%> gathered <S%H6908><s%> all Israel <S%H3478><s%> together <S%H6908><s%>, and they encamped <S%H2583><s%> in Gilboa <S%H1533><s%>.

And when Saul <S%H7586><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> the host <S%H4264><s%> of the Philistines <S%H6430><s%>, he was afraid <S%H3372><s%>, and his heart <S%H3820><s%> trembled <S%H2729><s%> greatly <S%H3966><s%>.

And when Saul <S%H7586><s%> inquired <S%H7592><s%> of Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>, Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> answered <S%H6030><s%> him not <S%H2472><s%>, neither by dreams, nor by Urim <S%H224><s%>, nor by prophets <S%H5030><s%>.

Then said <S%H559><s%> Saul <S%H7586><s%> unto his servants <S%H5650><s%>, Seek <S%H1245><s%> me a woman <S%H802><s%> that hath <S%H1172><s%> a familiar spirit <S%H178><s%>, that I may go <S%H3212><s%> to her <S%H1875><s%>, and inquire of her <S%H5650><s%>. And his servants said <S%H559><s%> to him <S%H802><s%>, Behold, there is a woman that hath <S%H1172><s%> a familiar spirit <S%H178><s%> at En-dor <S%H5874><s%>.

And Saul <S%H7586><s%> disguised <S%H2664><s%> himself <S%H3847><s%>, and put on other <S%H312><s%> raiment <S%H899><s%>, and went <S%H3212><s%>, he and two <S%H8147><s%> men <S%H582><s%> with him <S%H935><s%>, and they came to the woman <S%H802><s%> by night <S%H3915><s%>: and he said <S%H559><s%>, Divine <S%H7080><s%> unto me <S%H178><s%>, I pray thee, by the familiar spirit, and bring me up <S%H5927><s%> whomsoever I shall name unto thee <S%H559><s%>.

And the woman <S%H802><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto him <S%H3045><s%>, Behold, thou knowest what Saul <S%H7586><s%> hath done <S%H6213><s%>, how he hath cut off <S%H3772><s%> those that have familiar spirits <S%H178><s%>, and the wizards <S%H3049><s%>, out of the land <S%H776><s%>: wherefore then layest thou a snare <S%H5367><s%> for my life <S%H5315><s%>, to cause me to die <S%H4191><s%>?

And Saul <S%H7586><s%> sware <S%H7650><s%> to her by Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>, saying <S%H559><s%>, As Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> liveth <S%H2416><s%>, there shall <S%H518><s%> no punishment <S%H5771><s%> happen <S%H7136><s%> to thee for this thing <S%H1697><s%>.
Then said <S%H559><s%> the woman <S%H802><s%>, Whom shall I bring up <S%H5927><s%> unto thee <S%H559><s%>? And he said, Bring me up <S%H5927><s%> Samuel <S%H8050><s%>.

And when the woman <S%H802><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> Samuel <S%H8050><s%>, she cried <S%H2199><s%> with a loud <S%H1419><s%> voice <S%H6963><s%>; and the woman <S%H802><s%> spake <S%H559><s%> to Saul <S%H7586><s%>, saying <S%H559><s%>, Why hast thou deceived <S%H7411><s%> me <S%H7586><s%>? for thou art Saul.

And the king <S%H4428><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto her <S%H3372><s%>, Be not afraid: for what seest <S%H7200><s%> thou <S%H802><s%>? And the woman said <S%H559><s%> unto Saul <S%H7586><s%>, I see <S%H7200><s%> a god <S%H430><s%> coming up <S%H5927><s%> out of the earth <S%H776><s%>.

And he said <S%H559><s%> unto her <S%H8389><s%>, What form is he of <S%H559><s%>? And she said, An old <S%H2205><s%> man <S%H376><s%> cometh up <S%H5927><s%>; and he is covered <S%H5844><s%> with a robe <S%H4598><s%>. And Saul <S%H7586><s%> perceived <S%H3045><s%> that it was Samuel <S%H8050><s%>, and he bowed <S%H6915><s%> with his face <S%H639><s%> to the ground <S%H776><s%>, and did obeisance <S%H7812><s%>.

And Samuel <S%H8050><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to Saul <S%H7586><s%>, Why hast thou disquieted <S%H7264><s%> me <S%H5927><s%>, to bring me up? And Saul <S%H7586><s%> answered <S%H559><s%>, I am sore <S%H3966><s%> distressed <S%H6887><s%>; for the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> make war <S%H3898><s%> against me <S%H430><s%>, and God is departed <S%H5493><s%> from me <S%H6030><s%>, and answereth me no more <S%H3027><s%>, neither by prophets <S%H5030><s%>, nor by dreams <S%H2472><s%>: therefore I have called <S%H7121><s%> thee <S%H3045><s%>, that thou mayest make known unto me what I shall do <S%H6213><s%>.

And Samuel <S%H8050><s%> said <S%H559><s%>, Wherefore then dost thou ask <S%H7592><s%> of me <S%H3068><s%>, seeing Jehovah is departed <S%H5493><s%> from thee <S%H6145><s%>, and is become thine adversary?

And Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> hath done <S%H6213><s%> unto thee <S%H1696><s%>, as he spake by me <S%H3027><s%>: and Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> hath rent <S%H7167><s%> the kingdom <S%H4467><s%> out of thy hand <S%H3027><s%>, and given <S%H5414><s%> it to thy neighbor <S%H7453><s%>, even to David <S%H1732><s%>.

Because <S%H834><s%> thou obeyedst <S%H8085><s%> not the voice <S%H6963><s%> of Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>, and didst not execute <S%H6213><s%> his fierce <S%H2740><s%> wrath <S%H639><s%> upon Amalek <S%H6002><s%>, therefore hath Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> done <S%H6213><s%> this thing <S%H1697><s%> unto thee this day <S%H3117><s%>.

Moreover Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> will deliver <S%H5414><s%> Israel <S%H3478><s%> also with thee into the hand <S%H3027><s%> of the Philistines <S%H6430><s%>; and to-morrow <S%H4279><s%> shalt thou and thy sons <S%H1121><s%> be with me <S%H3068><s%>: Jehovah will deliver <S%H5414><s%> the host <S%H4264><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> also into the hand <S%H3027><s%> of the Philistines <S%H6430><s%>.

Then Saul <S%H7586><s%> fell <S%H5307><s%> straightway <S%H4116><s%> his full <S%H4393><s%> length <S%H6967><s%> upon the earth <S%H776><s%>, and was sore <S%H3966><s%> afraid <S%H3372><s%>, because of the words <S%H1697><s%> of Samuel <S%H8050><s%>: and there was no strength <S%H3581><s%> in him <S%H398><s%>; for he had eaten no bread <S%H3899><s%> all the day <S%H3117><s%>, nor all the night <S%H3915><s%>.

And the woman <S%H802><s%> came <S%H935><s%> unto Saul <S%H7586><s%>, and saw <S%H7200><s%> that he was sore <S%H3966><s%> troubled <S%H926><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%> unto him <S%H8198><s%>, Behold, thy handmaid hath hearkened <S%H8085><s%> unto thy voice <S%H6963><s%>, and I have put <S%H7760><s%> my life <S%H5315><s%> in my hand <S%H3709><s%>, and have hearkened <S%H8085><s%> unto thy words <S%H1697><s%> which thou spakest unto me <S%H1696><s%>.

Now therefore <S%H8085><s%>, I pray thee, hearken thou also unto the voice <S%H6963><s%> of thy handmaid <S%H8198><s%>, and let me set <S%H7760><s%> a morsel <S%H6595><s%> of bread <S%H3899><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> thee <S%H398><s%>; and eat, that thou mayest have strength <S%H3581><s%>, when thou goest <S%H3212><s%> on thy way <S%H1870><s%>.

But he refused <S%H3985><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%>, I will not eat <S%H398><s%>. But his servants <S%H5650><s%>, together with the woman <S%H802><s%>, constrained <S%H6555><s%> him <S%H8085><s%>; and he hearkened unto their voice <S%H6963><s%>. So he arose <S%H6965><s%> from the earth <S%H776><s%>, and sat <S%H3427><s%> upon the bed <S%H4296><s%>.

And the woman <S%H802><s%> had a fatted <S%H4770><s%> calf <S%H5695><s%> in the house <S%H1004><s%>; and she hasted <S%H4116><s%>, and killed <S%H2076><s%> it <S%H3947><s%>; and she took flour <S%H7058><s%>, and kneaded <S%H3888><s%> it <S%H644><s%>, and did bake unleavened bread thereof <S%H4682><s%>:

and she brought <S%H5066><s%> it before <S%H6440><s%> Saul <S%H7586><s%>, and before <S%H6440><s%> his servants <S%H5650><s%>; and they did eat <S%H398><s%>. Then they rose up <S%H6965><s%>, and went away <S%H3212><s%> that night <S%H3915><s%>.
